Sentencas: Balance of plant (BOP) components made of metallic materials in solid oxide fuel cells are subject to hightemperature corrosion and are a significant source of volatile chromium species.
Titulo: Evaluating candidate materials for balance of plant components in SOFC: Oxidation and Cr evaporation properties

Sentencas: Prospective Fe and Ni-base alloys, AISI 441, AISI 444, a FeCrAl alloy A197/Kanthal (R) EF101, alloy 600, and alloy 800H are investigated for their suitability to BOP components.
Titulo: Evaluating candidate materials for balance of plant components in SOFC: Oxidation and Cr evaporation properties

Sentencas: Oxidation kinetics and chromium evaporation were employed to study the selected alloys at 650 degrees C and 850 degrees C for 500 h. A197 performed the best while AISI 441 and AISI 444, performed the worst.
Titulo: Evaluating candidate materials for balance of plant components in SOFC: Oxidation and Cr evaporation properties

Sentencas: Pre-oxidation significantly improved the performance of the alloys at 650 0C.
Titulo: Evaluating candidate materials for balance of plant components in SOFC: Oxidation and Cr evaporation properties
